bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/4232>http://code.opencv.org/issues/4232</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Russell Priebe on 2015-03-08 23:40 || Priority: Low || Affected: 2.4.0 - 2.4.8 || Category: android || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: || Platform: ARM / Android </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>OpenCV Manager on Galaxy Note 4</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>I am developing an app that uses OpenCV. I just upgraded to a samsung galaxy note 4 (KitKat 4.4.4). I have installed OpenCV manager (a couple of times). When I run the OpenCV Manager, under "Device Information" it says "Hardware not Detected". When I run my app I get a dialog that says Package Not Found OpenCV libary package was not found. Try to install it? If I select "Yes" it takes me to the Play Store where it says "Item not Found".
If there is anything I can do to help debug, please let me know. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h5>Russell Priebe on 2015-03-09 05:06</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>affected version shown above is incorrect. It should read 2.4.9.0 rev 1 </denchmark-code>
